page.title: 01OGBOURNE ST ANDREW
page.content: {Ogbourne St Andrew}and Ogbourne St George are small quiet villages with a varied age range.The houses in them are mixed and made of stone and mortar, brick and mortar, thatch and clay tiles.Both villages have post offices combined with grocers.The houses are a mixture of privately owned, council and farm houses.The Swindon road passes by both places. There used to be a railway but the road is the only means of travel. Ogbourne St Andrew has a medium size church.3 arable farms dominate the area,concentrating on crops and dairy herds.A brook from a spring goes through the villages.Fields and woods surround them but they are slowly disappearing because of new developments.Both villages have a school as their focus;Ogbourne St Andrew is private,St George is state.
